# Joint Probability

>- In \textcolor{blue}{Rule 7} we have $P(A \cap B)$ for two sets $A = E$ and $B = F$. But how do you calculate $P(A \cap B)$ if all we know is the $P(A)$ and $P(B)$ but not $P(A \cup B)$?
